intro: Otiophora hebe, commonly known as the silver hebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the plantain family (Plantaginaceae) and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from violet to white, are pollinated by native bees and other insects. Otiophora hebe is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
